rules.natural: Provided that drug X is tested by Lab Alpha, drug X is manufactured by Company Beta.
If drug X is manufactured by Company Beta, then drug X is quality-checked by Inspector Gamma.
Drug X being quality-checked by Inspector Gamma implies that drug X is approved by the FDA.
Should Company Beta be audited by Agency Delta, then if Company Beta is compliant with regulations, whenever drug X is manufactured by Company Beta, drug X is approved by the FDA.
Company Beta being certified to standards leads to Company Beta being audited by Agency Delta.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(manufactured(drug_x, company_beta) -> approved(drug_x, fda)) -> recalled(drug_x, market)) -> investigated(drug_x, authorities))
rules.natural: Assuming it is not the case that the failure of drug X being manufactured by Company Beta to imply FDA approval results in a market recall, then drug X is investigated by the authorities.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(manufactured(drug_x, company_beta) -> approved(drug_x, fda)) -> recalled(drug_x, market)) -> -investigated(drug_x, authorities))
rules.natural: Given that it is not true that the absence of the implication from drug X being manufactured by Company Beta to FDA approval causes a market recall, then drug X is not investigated by the authorities.
In the scenario where Company Beta is not certified to standards, Company Beta is fined by the regulator.
If Company Beta is not certified to standards, then Company Beta is not fined by the regulator.
Whenever drug X is not safe for patients, drug X is tested by Lab Alpha.

facts.natural: Company Beta is compliant with regulations.
It is not the case that drug X is approved by the FDA.
Drug X is not recalled from the market.

target.natural: Drug X is safe for patients.
